title: I'm so fed up of seeing Vayne in literally every single fucking game.
body:
Holy fucking shit, I'm so tired of this bitch already.

Vayne Thresh vs Jinx Leona is really starting to get boring and old.

{{champion:67}} "oh but I have a weak early game I work hard to reach my late game power"
Meanwhile tower dives enemy bot lane with a cutlass and gets a double while escaping with her low CD Q. 
Pls gut this bitch.

>"This one thing that once happened when I played a this certain player who was doing well equals that champion and totally happens all the time."

Can we all collectively agree to _stop_ doing this please?  It's unproductive and lowers the level of community discussion.
Hell, I got a Quadra-Kill as _**Gangplank**_ for crying out loud!

And it wasn't even reworked Gangplank, it was the old _viable-if-every-other-champion-was-nerfed_, "Yarr! Imma Pirate, matey! Stackin' me Avarice Blades for bank(plank)!" Gangplank.

In theory, I agree with you. But this is not a one time thing for Vayne. It's pretty much every game. Her mobility and CC makes her basically a second support for herself, and she can get out of situations extremely easily.
And god forbid you any sort of champion without HARD cc and or have low mobility..
never lost to a vayne as cait.. many varus players can out play her too
dude critplank was feast or famine. If you got fed your q oneshotted every squishy on the planet. It's not hard.
Exactly my point!  You can't treat every Gangplank like one who has feasted.
I'm more fed up with Jinx, she's been relevant ever since release and Riot refuse to give her a meaningful nerf, yet they don't think twice when it comes to hammering Lucian.

This is just my opinion here but I think her bonus damage in rocket form should be removed. To be honest there is no con to using it other than not being able to DPS fast enough, which is why she has minigun form. The benefits of using Rocket form is just too high. Obviously we can't remove her AOE crits and range, but why should she be getting all that with 10% extra damage which gets better with the more AD she has.

Just because they're not good for dueling doesn't mean they're not ideal for team fights, or wave clearing. Or that they don't deal pretty huge chunks of damage to multiple enemies when used.

If the damage on them was "absurd", you'd be able to abuse it for more than just long-ranged "better safe than sorry" instances. You'd just throw it out cause it's free and it's good. There's CLEARLY many instances where you'd rather use Pow-Pow (wearing down tanks, dueling, split pushing a turret, quickly finishing off a turret) and CLEARLY instances where you'd rather use Fishbones (when you need to reach something but don't want to/can't be within 525 range to do so), so their damage isn't absurd because it doesn't overshadow the rest of her kit. It fits nicely within it with its own set of weaknesses. That's what I was trying to get across.

And NO SHIT they're ideal for team fights. Her usual range is freaking 525 with extremely limited escaped options. Why on Earth would you go into a team fight with Pow-Pow? You start with Fishbones, then clean up with Pow-Pow and her passive. I'm pretty sure it even says this in the champ tips tab or something when you select her during champ select.

You are getting really pedantic with your word use here. The damage it does is exceptionally high (on par with AoE spells) however you only feel the full effect when she crits your whole team and you immediately lose the fight.

Auto Attacks (namely crits) on the whole need a rework (there is no reason they should do significantly more than spells) and Jinx is just an abuse case.

I will also counter you this. Jinx was the strongest ADC even in the assassin meta. How is that possible for an immobile ADC champ to do well vs assassins, a meta that favored hyper mobile burst damage, unless they bring a stupid amount of other things to the table?

Her kit's just good for team fighting due to the ranges on her rockets, Zap, and SMDR. You can't blame a champ for being "good", and the only way she's not gonna see as much play is if you straight up gut her kit, which is, once again, spiteful and unnecessary.

First of all, I'm personally tired of people talking about stutter stepping. Jinx has no escapes. This "advice" is just bait to get low elo players slain by dashing/blinking/jumping/hooking engages. Now, you SHOULD shoot and move, but don't make it look like you're gonna escape a charging Garen or something just because you're stutter stepping.

Anywho, if you don't have good attack speed, you're gonna get 1-2 rockets off before you're done shooting. In games, the best cc is death. Splashing their whole team a few times is cute, but if no one dies, nothing was accomplished. Bursting one target down with more attack speed and slightly lower range on someone like Cait/Ashe/Trist is technically more effective than throwing out sluggish aoes UNLESS someone actually dies from the aoes. It's a give and take. If Jinx is safe, but doesn't kill anyone, what's the point? Now we're making it even harder for someone with no escapes...to land kills? Not fair.

Agreed.

Her rockets are basically twitch's ultimate (with full damage to all targets hit instead of a 20% reduction for each to a minimum of 40%), without a CD as a basic ability; she just doesn't have any steroids to stack with it like Twitch does. Her passive means if her team starts to win the fight it's an ace, and she is almost guaranteed to be out if the team is losing as long as one kill happens, and her minigun form lets her take towers faster than just about anyone in the game.

While she may have a reasonable win rate because of her lack of mobility, and doesn't see a ton of competitive play, she just outclasses so many of the other ADCs in terms of damage and utility (multi-target snare, very long ranged poke + a slow, faster turret removal, and a global execute).

Lucian getting hammered was deserved initially, but IMO, they went about it the wrong way. He's too feast/famine now because of the short range. The biggest problem with him was his passive: getting double autos and an AA reset after every ability gave him obscene burst at all points in the game; toning the second auto down to 30-50% damage based on level or ult rank would have been a reasonable thing to test initially rather than  a range reduction. Aside from that, his E should never have removed slows.
